S* Giving recommended or available dates in each case.
Compile all of this which is humanly possible by the time
of the Ann Arbor meeting so the Executive Committee may go overffend
help in the final refinements so the letter can then be got off
to Bill Griffiths within a few days of the Ann Arbor meeting. In
order to do this, I suggest you get Jim's help and both of you tie
up the long distance lines for a couple of days and come up with
some pretty firm recommendations. I really don't know whether it
can be done by the last of next week or not, but at least enough of
it can be firmed up to make the story much more complete to Bill
than my presentation.
Hearings on our TV bill are scheduled for Wednesday or
Thursday of next week - May 21-22. That means that I may not be
able to get to Ann Arbor at all. Realizing the importance of that
meeting and the necessity that we get a great deal of work done on
plans for next year, this is veiy unfortunate. If the hearings are
postponed, I will plan to be there. If they go off on schedule, I
will be glad to come to urbana on the early part of the week May 2b
to work with yoi^ and perhaps Jim, for as long as is necessary to
complete the Kellogg budget and the FAE budget requests and will be
glad to go from Urbana with you to Battle Creek to talk to Bob VanDuyn
and Hugh Masters. As things stand now, I think you may as well count
me out of the Ann Arbor meeting. Things are popping in this state and
our bill stands a good chance of passage. It is important that I be
at the hearings and cb some lobbying in order to assure that if the
bill passes, we will be given favorable consideration for a station
at the University.
Another matter which should concern the Executive Committee
at the Ann Arbor meeting is a request for funds from Kellogg or FAE
and the Center to establish a very extensive TV station program
consultation service. This is the significant area of activity in
the two years ahead and FAE is sold on the idea that this is a
project for NAEB to supervise. When we draft this proposal, we should
not spare the horses but should toss a budget at them that compares
with the JCET budget of $1^5,000.00 annually.
